messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/Admin/PostThumbnailController.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Admin\\PostThumbnailController::destroy` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full request path:
- /admin/posts/{post}/thumbnail

HTTP methods:
- All methods acceptable: false
- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: false
- PUT: false
- DELETE: true
- PATCH: false

Explanation / reasoning:
- routes/admin.php contains the route declaration:
  Route::delete('/posts/{post}/thumbnail', [PostThumbnailController::class, 'destroy'])->name('posts_thumbnail.destroy');
  This explicitly registers a DELETE route for the path /posts/{post}/thumbnail.
- The controller (PostThumbnailController::destroy) redirects to route('admin.posts.edit', $post). The usage of the route name "admin.posts.edit" indicates the routes in routes/admin.php are loaded with a name prefix "admin." (this is how the admin route names are referenced), and in typical Laravel setup routes/admin.php is grouped with a URL prefix "admin". Combining that with the route declaration yields the full path /admin/posts/{post}/thumbnail.
- Because the route is registered with Route::delete(...), only the DELETE HTTP method is accepted by this route based on the code. No other HTTP methods (HEAD, GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, OPTIONS, TRACE) are declared for this route in the provided code. (Middleware or server-level handling of OPTIONS/TRACE is outside the scope of the route declaration and thus not counted here.)
